name: Castlewood House

reviews.text: A group of friends decided to go to Ireland for Christmas week through New Years Eve...we booked Castlewood House after checking with Trip Advisor...what and incredible place...clean, beautiful, perfectly located...I highly recommend Castlewood House...Brian and his younger brother David couldn't have been better hosts...I can't wait to return this summer!
reviews.title: LOVE THIS PLACE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully decorated and immaculately clean property overlooking Dingle Bay. THE BEST place we stayed during our whole trip. The room was very clean and the bathrooms were immaculate (a rarity, we found). Bathroom had jetted tub and separate shower. Even had a towel warmer--what more could you ask for! Breakfast was delicious--the best selection we had out of the 4 B&Bs we stayed at. Try Helen's Breakfast Treat--Yum! Brian and Helen were wonderful hosts!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.disliked: — Highest priced of places we stayed, but probably worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long overnight flight from the US and a car trip from the Shannon Airport to Dingle we stumbled on the lovely Castlewood House. It is a brand new guest house, and fortunately for us we were able to obtain a room. The bedroom and bath were really first class, and we were quickly able to recover from the ordeal of our trip. Castlewood has a lovely setting overlooking Dingle Bay and is only a short walk to town. In addition to the great room, the owners serve a fantastic breakfast in the morning. The owners are delightful and we could not have had a better place to start our visit of Ireland.
reviews.title: Beautiful Guest House; Great setting

likes.liked: — Great room and bathroom, wonderful breakfast

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: This small inn was the highlight of our trip to Ireland. The building is new with all the latest amenities. The room was spacious, bed very comfortable and bathroom modern with a great shower and jacuzzi. A DVD player was also in our room, with a selection of DVDs available for free. The owners provided exceptional service and called us by name each time we spoke to them. But the best part of the trip was the breakfast - absolutely delicious. Not your standard traditional Irish fare, but a big gourmet step up. I highly recommend the salmon omelette. Fresh and tasty, a wonderful way to start the day. Will definitely go back!

reviews.title: highlight of our trip
reviews.text: Our family spent two nights at this B and B in Dingle.

reviews.title: Very good indeed
reviews.text: I agree with the reviews here. The breakfast is amazing. The rooms are very nice indeed and the guesthouse is very nicely positioned just 10mins walk from the centre of Dingle village. Dingle itself deserves just one quick visit for dinner. While the Dingle pennisula is not as impressive as either Kerry or Beara. However, this hotel makes a fantastic stop-over & I thoroughly enjoyed staying there. Good value too.

Words cannot do justice to Brian and Helen's wonderful inn on Dingle Bay. You'll think you're home ... or wish you lived this nicely ... and then you'll start wondering how to convince them to come home and cook the finest breakfast you've ever eaten every day forever. Don't miss Dingle and don't pass on a chance to stay here.
reviews.title: Incomparable

likes.liked: — Great rooms with great baths and great beds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Castlewood house was great. Definitely the nicest place we stayed on our trip. Beautiful view, yet close to town. Breakfast was phenominal. Pancakes couldn't be beat! Can't imagine a nicer place to stay in Dingle.

description: Our luxurious guest house is located on the shores of Dingle Bay, so it enjoys a fabulous view while just being a five minute walk to the vibrant centre of Dingle town.
